Can you believe this is only Ash’s first year at Front today? When I started the search for a head of HR, different advisors warned me that it was going to be a long, arduous process, especially if I wanted to find someone who could live up to, maintain and expand the great culture we had already built. A few candidates later, and I definitely understood what they meant. Then I met Ash, and I knew the search was over. Ash is the best HR leader I’ve met, by a margin. She’s both strategic AND very hands-on, she cares about every single Fronteer, so much so that she knows when they need to be backed and when they need to be challenged (myself included!). I think it’s not an overstatement to say that everyone likes her at Front, but I know her team truly loves her. Ash, I couldn’t thank you enough for all the impact you’ve had this year. Keeping a great culture in a high growth environment might be one of our biggest challenges, and everyday you help make it a reality. I look forward to next year, and the year after, and the year after 


\"A Fronteer once said, \"Ash is real hush-hush incredible at her job.\" I couldn't agree more. As a steward of our culture, she applies #highstandards and #care to her work every day. She also manages to be extremely #lowego, with so much of her work being done in private. Over the past year, Ash has helped us all build resilience. She pushes Fronteers to practice radical candor even when it's hard (especially when it's hard). She built more structured leveling and compensation bands across our teams, ensuring we stay competitive externally while also fair internally (which is not an easy feat). She spearheaded and rolled out The Lego Program, our very first performance management program (which is so delightfully Front-esque). The list goes on and on, but this is already getting quite long... and hey, it's the end of the day, and I just want to kick it with her at Bluxome Winery . Ash, thank you for everything that you do. I'm so fortunate to call you my work person™ and person person™! (if you have not played the work person™ / person person™  game before, I highly recommend asking Maggie about it)\"
(Gwen)

\"The TL;DR  
Ash is literally one of the best things that has happened to me over my last 3.5+ years at Front 

She is one the most #caring, supportive, and #transparent managers who is always thinking about her team's growth and is always #radicallycandid to help each of us improve  I feel so fortunate to have a manager that I can respect, trust, learn from and just be real with, whether it's work or personal related. Not only is Ash one of the best managers ever, but she's also a kick-ass HR leader who knows how to get shit done with care and integrity. I will forever feel grateful to Nate A. for introducing us to one of the best HR people in the industry (since apparently HR people have a bad reputation and it's hard to find anyone good ). 

Happy Frontversary, Ash! You've been such a blessing to the People team and everyone at Front. I truly believe that our company is so much better off than one year ago because of you. Thank you for all that you do &  to many more years to come   
    
 Ashley (p.s. there's no one else I'd rather share a name with!! )\" 

\"Just over a year ago, I was on the interview panel for Ash and here what I wrote in my feedback:
 
And boy! did she not disappoint. I've worked very closely with Ash in her first year and she is an amazing partner: she cares deeply about each and every person on my team and works incredibly hard to push us as an organization to the next level. Ash's work ethic is amazing...and she is also a lot of fun to be around.

Ash, we're so lucky to have you here at Front and look forward to many more anniversaries to come!\" 
(Shane)
